enrich_metadata.label: Beverly Hills, California
enrich_metadata.mention_address: Beverly Hills, Los Angeles County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.abstract: Beverly Hills is a city in Los Angeles County, California, United States, surrounded by the cities of Los Angeles and West Hollywood. Originally a Spanish ranch where lima beans were grown, Beverly Hills was incorporated in 1914 by a group of investors who had failed to find oil, but found water instead and eventually decided to develop it into a town. By 2013, its population had grown to 34,658. Sometimes referred to as "90210", one of its primary ZIP codes, it is home to many actors and celebrities. The city includes the Rodeo Drive shopping district and the Beverly Hills Oil Field.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Beverly_Hills,_California
enrich_metadata.comment: Beverly Hills is a city in Los Angeles County, California, United States, surrounded by the cities of Los Angeles and West Hollywood. Originally a Spanish ranch where lima beans were grown, Beverly Hills was incorporated in 1914 by a group of investors who had failed to find oil, but found water instead and eventually decided to develop it into a town. By 2013, its population had grown to 34,658. Sometimes referred to as "90210", one of its primary ZIP codes, it is home to many actors and celebrities. The city includes the Rodeo Drive shopping district and the Beverly Hills Oil Field.

enrich_metadata.label: San Juan Capistrano, California
enrich_metadata.mention_address: San Juan Capistrano, Orange County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.abstract: San Juan Capistrano (/sæn ˌwɑːn kæpᵻˈstrɑːnoʊ/; [saŋ ˈxwaŋ kapisˈtɾano]) is a city in Orange County, California, United States. The current OMB metropolitan designation for San Juan Capistrano and the Orange County Area is "Santa Ana-Anaheim-Irvine, CA." The population was 34,593 at the 2010 census, up from 33,826 at the 2000 census. The city was created around Mission San Juan Capistrano, and many of the homes and strip malls resemble the Spanish architecture that composes the building. It is home to the widest variety of homes in Orange County, including those built prior to 1900 in its central district (some being adobes from the 18th century). San Juan Capistrano formerly hosted a population of cliff swallows that migrate each year from Argentina to the Mission San Juan Capistrano.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/San_Juan_Capistrano,_California

The current OMB metropolitan designation for San Juan Capistrano and the Orange County Area is "Santa Ana-Anaheim-Irvine, CA." The population was 34,593 at the 2010 census, up from 33,826 at the 2000 census. The city was created around Mission San Juan Capistrano, and many of the homes and strip malls resemble the Spanish architecture that composes the building. It is home to the widest variety of homes in Orange County, including those built prior to 1900 in its central district (some being adobes from the 18th century). San Juan Capistrano formerly hosted a population of cliff swallows that migrate each year from Argentina to the Mission San Juan Capistrano.

attraction_reviewComments: We loved this so much we're planning another longer trip for next year. Enjoyed the winery tasting rooms, the wine, the people - staff and guests. We never had anything but great... read more
Tastings are usually available from 10 AM to 5 PM and range in price from $10 - $15 per person for about five to six different wines. Firestone and Bridlewood have excellent... read more
Diverse scenery, restaurants, and things to do. Highlights include the Dutch town of Solvang, Santa Ynez Mission & Chumash Casino. Gorgeous wine country vistas.
The Santa Ynez Valley is a beautiful wine region and well kept secret. It is first and foremost just a stunning landscape encircled by mountains on four sides. The valley is a... read more
I love all of the valley. The rolling hills and small quaint town. I visited here often and finally moved here this year and love everything about it.
If you want to leave the crazy city and see beautiful rolling hills this is the place. Gorgeous natural views. Clean air just a piece of heaven.
Nice area. Good shop. For. Boots and hats. Tops is back at the ranch. Good wine tour. At ranch to Wine tasting. Horse back riding. See ocean
So much to see and we just drove all over the valley. We love to drive with no time restrictions and go and enjoy the scenery. Met locals and they were very friendly and helpful.

attraction_reviewComments: We were here for a wedding and it served as a backdrop to the perfect spot. Awesome setting and big enough for many groups of beach goers too.
My husband and I were married here in June '12. Moonstone is such an incredible place that offers easy access to either side of the beach. Dog friendly. Make sure if you are... read more
We have been all up and down the west coast. Have visited the Trinidad area many times and somehow never walked Moonstone Beach. It is now our favorite west coast beach. Check... read more
the feel of the sand, the rock faces, good food nearby, great area to fly kites, good area for pictures
The road getting to this little beach is narrow and bumpy in places, so stay on the 101 until you have to get off. The beach itself is lovely: quiet, clearly a good place for dogs... read more
This time of year (March) the beach was pretty quiet and the dogs all well-behaved. An easy access beach to enjoy and relax.

enrich_metadata.label: San Diego
enrich_metadata.mention_address: San Diego, San Diego County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.abstract: San Diego /ˌsæn diːˈeɪɡoʊ/ (Spanish for "Saint Didacus") is a major city in California, on the coast of the Pacific Ocean in Southern California, approximately 120 miles (190 km) south of Los Angeles and immediately adjacent to the border with Mexico. With an estimated population of 1,381,069 as of July 1, 2014, San Diego is the eighth-largest city in the United States and second-largest in California. San Diego is the birthplace of California and is known for its mild year-round climate, natural deep-water harbor, extensive beaches, long association with the U.S. Navy, and recent emergence as a healthcare and biotechnology development center. Historically home to the Kumeyaay people, San Diego was the first site visited by Europeans on what is now the West Coast of the United States. Upon landing in San Diego Bay in 1542, Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo claimed the entire area for Spain, forming the basis for the settlement of Alta California 200 years later. The Presidio and Mission of San Diego, founded in 1769, formed the first European settlement in what is now California. In 1821, San Diego became part of newly independent Mexico, and in 1850, became part of the United States following the Mexican–American War and the admission of California to the union. The city is the seat of San Diego County and is the economic center of the region as well as the San Diego–Tijuana metropolitan area. San Diego's main economic engines are military and defense-related activities, tourism, international trade, and manufacturing. The presence of the University of California, San Diego (UCSD), with the affiliated UCSD Medical Center, has helped make the area a center of research in biotechnology.

enrich_metadata.label: Civic Center, Bakersfield
enrich_metadata.abstract: Civic Center is a district in Downtown Bakersfield, California. It is the center of government for the City of Bakersfield and the County of Kern, containing a collection of buildings used by the city, county, state, and federal governments. The district also contains all of downtown's sporting complexes. It also has the Rabobank Theater and Convention Center, which is the largest theater and convention facilities in the city.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Civic_Center,_Bakersfield

enrich_metadata.label: Sonora, California
enrich_metadata.abstract: Not to be confused with Sonoma, California. Sonora is the county seat of Tuolumne County, California. The city population was 4,903 during the 2010 Census, up from 4,423 during the 2000 Census. Sonora is the only incorporated community in Tuolumne County.

enrich_metadata.label: Burbank, California
enrich_metadata.abstract: Burbank is a city in Los Angeles County in Southern California, United States, 12 miles (19 km) northwest of downtown Los Angeles. The population at the 2010 census was 103,340. Billed as the "Media Capital of the World" and only a few miles northeast of Hollywood, numerous media and entertainment companies are headquartered or have significant production facilities in Burbank, including The Walt Disney Company, Warner Bros. Entertainment, ABC Studios, ABC Family, Marvel Studios, Nickelodeon, NBC, and Insomniac Games. The city is also home to Bob Hope Airport. Burbank also holds a special place in aerospace history since Lockheed's Skunk Works in Burbank produced some of the most secret and technologically advanced airplanes, including the U-2 spy planes that uncovered the Soviet Union missile components in Cuba. Burbank consists of two distinct areas: a downtown, in the foothills of the Verdugo Mountains, and flatlands, at the east end of the San Fernando Valley. At one time, it was referred to as "Beautiful Downtown Burbank" on Laugh-In and The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson. The city was named after David Burbank, a New Hampshire-born dentist and entrepreneur.
